Bullitt and P. A. Ross, the Committee to draft aB
Address to the public on the subject ofthe Opelousas road
and to memorialize Congress and the Legislature for tracts
of land along- the route, and other assistance, in aid of the
enterprize, as directed by resolutions of the Convention
adopted yesterday.
On motion of Mr. Eichaedson, the Committee took a
recess of thirty minutes, to afford opportunity for the dele,
gations to nominate members of the Permanent Committee
in the respective Parishes.
At the expiration of the half hour, the assembly was
again called to order by the President; whereupon the
following Permanent Committees, nominated by the
respective delegations, were, on motion, unanimously
elected by the Convention :
PERMANENT COMMITTEES :
